1.title_api: Ticats take it outside in lead up to Riders rematch
1.caption_api: Terrence Toliver is a fan of coach June Jones’ walk-throughs. “I love it,” says the Ticat wide reciever.
1.desc_api: While the Hamilton Tiger-Cats will certainly make some tweaks and twists in reaction to playing the same opponent back-to-back, this week’s change in the offence’s practice routine isn’t part of that adjustment.

2.caption_api: Ticat offensive tackle Avery Jordan is the younger brother of two-time NBA rebound leader DeAndre Jordan.
2.desc_api: Where there could conflict and envy, there is friendship and incentive.

3.title_api: Even at receiver, he’s still Speedy B
3.desc_api: June Jones doesn’t believe Brandon Banks will have to change his nickname any time soon.

4.title_api: Jones ponders change following loss, bye week
4.caption_api: Brandon Banks led the CFL in receptions and targets going into week five.
4.desc_api: The Hamilton Tiger-Cats return to practice Sunday morning for the first time in 10 days, preparing to ride in the CFL’s early-season Rematch Rodeo.

5.title_api: Ticats strength coach Ike Brown has been through it
5.caption_api: Former Tiger-Cats linebacker Ike Brown will also be looked to for mentorship as the team’s new strength-and-conditioning coach.
5.desc_api: The Hamilton Tiger-Cats are deep into multi-tasking — witness the positional flexibility of Nikita Whitlock; the offensive line; the secondary — and the hiring of former linebacker Ticat Ike Brown as strength-and-conditioning coach is a reflection of that.

6.title_api: QB pressure? For Ticats it’s a gut feeling
6.desc_api: The CFL isn’t compiling “quarterback pressure” defensive stats this year — which is too bad for the guys in the middle of the Hamilton Tiger-Cats line — so we’ll just have to go with the way we used to rate it: with the naked eye.

7.caption_api: Tiger-Cats coach June Jones has praised Landon Rice’s play at tight end early this season.
7.desc_api: Landon Rice came into training camp prepared, but most Ticat observers assumed the preparation was to play right guard.

8.title_api: Ticats tripping up chances to rival 2015 juggernaut
8.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats quarterback Jeremiah Masoli, left, is chased by Saskatchewan Roughriders defensive lineman Charleston Hughes during second half of Thursday’s game in Regina.
8.desc_api: The 2018 team shows some of those ’15 traits. But they aren’t there yet, clearly, writes Drew Edwards.

9.title_api: Close, but no win for the Ticats … again
9.caption_api: Saskatchewan Roughriders quarterback Brandon Bridge hurdles over Hamilton Tiger-Cats defensive back Mike Daly before fumbling the ball during first half CFL action at Mosaic Stadium in Regina Thursday.
9.desc_api: 18-13 loss to the Roughriders is the fifth of six under June Jones by less than eight points, writes Steve Milton

10.title_api: Ticats vs Riders: This can be a season tone-setter
10.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger Cats vs. Winnipeg Blue Bombers at Tim Hortons Field in Hamilton last Friday. Cats Ted Laurent greets fan at the end of the game.
10.desc_api: Hamilton can go to 3-1 for first time since 2004

11.title_api: Don McAuliffe, star of ‘52 Michigan State title team, dies
11.caption_api: This undated photo provided by Michigan State University shows Don McAuliffe. Former Michigan State football star Don McAuliffe, a fighter in his youth, battled to the very end. The star running back and captain for Michigan State‚Äôs undefeated 1952 national championship team has died at age 90 on Saturday, July 14, 2018. (Michigan State University via AP)
11.desc_api: Don McAuliffe, star of ‘52 Michigan State title team, dies

12.title_api: BC Lions know they need to find more consistency on defence
12.caption_api: There was a bit of divine intervention at play in the BC Lions’ come-from-behind win last weekend, but the team can’t count on that happening every week, says coach Wally Buono.
12.desc_api: There was a bit of divine intervention at play in the BC Lions’ come-from-behind win last weekend, but the team can’t count on that happening every week, says coach Wally Buono.

13.title_api: Clemson using Tide loss as motivation heading into fall camp
13.caption_api: FILE - In this Monday, Jan. 1, 2018 file photo, Clemson quarterback Kelly Bryant (2) is sacked by Alabama defensive lineman Da’Shawn Hand (9) in the second half of the Sugar Bowl semi-final playoff game for the NCAA college football national championship, in New Orleans. Clemson‚Äôs disappointing loss in the College Football Playoff to Alabama last January is never far from players‚Äô minds as they prepare for the upcoming season. (AP Photo/Butch Dill, File)
13.desc_api: Clemson using Tide loss as motivation heading into fall camp

14.title_api: Rams agree to 5-year extension with Brandin Cooks
14.caption_api: FILE - In this Monday, May 21, 2018 file photo,Los Angeles Rams’ Brandin Cooks trains during a football practice in Thousand Oaks, Calif. The Los Angeles Rams have agreed to a five-year extension with wide receiver Brandin Cooks, Tuesday, July 17, 2018. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson, File)
14.desc_api: Rams agree to 5-year extension with Brandin Cooks

15.title_api: Arizona Cardinals suspend GM 5 weeks after extreme DUI plea
15.caption_api: FILE - In this Wednesday, Feb. 28, 2018 file photo, Arizona Cardinals general manager Steve Keim speaks during a press conference at the NFL football scouting combine in Indianapolis. Arizona Cardinals general manager Steve Keim has pleaded guilty to extreme DUI after a Fourth of July arrest in a Phoenix suburb, Tuesday, July 17, 2018. (AP Photo/Darron Cummings, File)
15.desc_api: Arizona Cardinals suspend GM 5 weeks after extreme DUI plea

16.title_api: Texas goes from compliant to committed, winning with Herman
16.caption_api: Oklahoma linebacker Kenneth Murray speaks during NCAA college football Big 12 media days in Frisco, Texas, Monday, July 16, 2018. (AP Photo/Cooper Neill)
16.desc_api: Herman’s Horns part of 2nd day of Big 12 football media days

17.title_api: Lions linebacker Elimimian out with injury
17.caption_api: BC Lions’ Solomon Elimimian (56) can’t hold onto this pass intended for Winnipeg Blue Bombers’ Weston Dressler (7) during the second half of CFL action in Winnipeg Saturday, October 28, 2017. There was a bit of divine intervention at play in the B.C. Lions come-from-behind win last weekend, but the team can’t count on that happening every week, says coach Wally Buono. THE CANADIAN PRESS/John Woods
17.desc_api: B.C. Lions all-star linebacker Solomon Elimimian placed on injured list

18.title_api: Als QB Mathews out 4-6 weeks with foot injury
18.desc_api: Alouettes quarterback Mathews out 4-6 weeks with foot injury; Willy to return

19.title_api: Former NFL receiving star Owens activates window with Eskimos
19.caption_api: Terrell Owens isn’t finished with football just yet. According to a Canadian Football League source, the former National Football League receiver has activated a 10-day window to receive a contract offer from the Edmonton Eskimos by July 24 or force them to relinquish his rights.
19.desc_api: Terrell Owens wants to kick-start his pro football career in Canada.

20.title_api: The Latest: Oklahoma State RB offsets questions elsewhere
20.caption_api: West Virginia head coach Dana Holgorsen speaks during the NCAA college football Big 12 media days in Frisco, Texas, Tuesday, July 17, 2018. (AP Photo/Cooper Neill)
20.desc_api: The Latest: Coach says WVU QB Grier ready for Heisman grind

21.title_api: Forge FC’s name a nod to city’s past and future
21.caption_api: David Clanachan,Commissionaire of Canadian Premier League along with Bob Young co-founder of Forge FC wave official team flags of their new team. Official launch of Hamilton’s newest soccer team “Forge FC”. Hamilton Professional Soccer Club and the Canadian Premier League will officially unveil Hamilton’s CPL club name, crest, secondary logo and colours.
21.desc_api: The colour scheme is new, but rooted in local tradition. The name is rooted in local history, but points toward the future.

22.title_api: Briles talk sparks ire in Texas
22.desc_api: Disgraced former Baylor head coach Art Briles, who was briefly hired by the Hamilton Tiger-Cats last season, has seen another potential employment opportunity met by vocal opposition.

23.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli marches Ticats to hometown win over Bombers
23.caption_api: Bombers running back Andrew Harris grabs Ticat Delvin Breaux’s face mask.
23.desc_api: There is a school of thought in the CFL that says it’s perfectly OK for a defence to give up a bunch of short-range stuff underneath, challenging offences to complete pass after pass to move the ball down the field. Only the elite quarterbacks, the thinking goes, are accurate enough to get it done.

24.title_api: Ray’s injury graphic example of CFL’s graphic reality
24.caption_api: Ricky Ray is taken off the field on a stretcher Saturday. He was injured on a play against the Calgary Stampeders.
24.desc_api: As news of the injury to Toronto Argonauts quarterback Ricky Ray spread across social media on Saturday night, the words of support and offers of prayer came pouring in.

25.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on Ticats starting QB job
25.caption_api: Jeremiah Masoli has stared down and outperformed two of the top quarterbacks, on the road, the first two weeks of the CFL schedule.
25.desc_api: Though it will likely disappoint the I-want-to-see-Johnny crowd, Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on the Hamilton Tiger-Cats starting quarterback job.

26.title_api: Riders vs. Ticats: Starting field position key in rematch
26.caption_api: Brandon Bridge hurdles over Ticat Mike Daly in Hamilton’s 18-13 loss to Saskatchewan early this month. The Rider QB, who backed up Zach Collaros at the outset of the season, is expected to get the start in Thursday’s rematch.
26.desc_api: Ticats offence also needs to be better and more creative to end ‘green hex.’

36.title_api: Willy faces tough task against Stampeders
36.caption_api: Montreal Alouettes quarterback Drew Willy passes against the B.C. Lions during the second half of a CFL football game in Vancouver on June 16, 2018. You’ve got to feel for Drew Willy. The Montreal Alouettes quarterback returns from the injured list just in time to face the undefeated Calgary Stampeders and their tough defence. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darryl Dyck
36.desc_api: Willy returns to Alouettes in time to face league-leading Stampeders

37.title_api: CPL players will come from five ‘pools’
37.caption_api: The new Canadian Premier League logo is shown in this handout image.
37.desc_api: With Hamilton’s pro soccer franchise formally launched, and opening kickoff just nine months away, the next public discussion revolves around where Forge FC (Football Club) and the rest of the Canadian Premier League (CPL) will get their players.
